Hi, Iâ€™m Lennart! ðŸ‘‹ðŸ™‚

Iâ€™m a doctoral student and research associate in the Econometrics Group at Bielefeld University. I like data science and math, teaching both, and developing open source software. In my spare time, you can find me in front of a chess board or above the clouds.







Research Interests






Discrete choice models, in particular preference heterogeneity and Bayesian estimation of latent class mixed multinomial probit models.
Numerical optimization, in particular methods for efficient and robust initialization.
Hidden Markov models, in particular hierarchical extensions to improve trend detection in financial time series across different time scales.










Recent Talks






Faster and more robust maximum likelihood estimation for random utility models, ICMC in Puerto Varas, 01.04.2024
Modeling unobserved choice behavior heterogeneity, 13th YRW at Bielefeld University, 16.02.2024
Facilitating probit likelihood optimization, Statistische Woche in Dortmund, 12.09.2023
Bayesian probit models for preference classification, IWSM in Dortmund, 18.07.2023
Initialization of numerical optimization in R, 12th YRW at Bielefeld University, 07.09.2023
Advances in the initialization of probit model estimation and the {ino} R package, 11th YRW at Bielefeld University, 18.11.2022










Teaching





Several lectures and tutorials in statistics and math. See here for a complete list.









Software






ao: Alternating Optimization
choicedata: Working with Choice Data
fHMM: Fitting Hidden Markov Models to Financial Data
